examples: The town is three miles away.
The kangaroo was making mincemeat of him.
Many more businesses are feeling the chill wind of the recession.
The universal language of art is bridging a divide.
Then again, some major thinkers are way ahead of the curve.
words.defineEn: to have an existence or presence
words.defineVi: để có một sự tồn tại hoặc sự hiện diện

examples: I woke up with the mother of all hangovers.
They usually wake up at 7 o'clock on weekdays.
She woke up and found herself in a hospital bed.
We woke up early and took a dip in the sea before breakfast.
I wake up early every morning to go for a run.
words.defineEn: to no longer be asleep
words.defineVi: không còn buồn ngủ

examples: Sleep well and sweet dreams.
I slept like a log until morning.
I usually sleep like a baby.
I didn't sleep a wink last night.
I usually sleep for eight hours every night.
words.defineEn: to rest our mind and body, with our eyes closed
words.defineVi: để tâm trí và cơ thể của chúng ta nghỉ ngơi, với đôi mắt nhắm lại

examples: The students worked their heart and soul on their project.
Not working my foot.
Soymilk works well as a substitute for milk in sauces and creamy pasta dishes.
My dad works forty hours a week.
To work clay.
words.defineEn: to do a job or task, usually for a company or organization, in order to receive money
words.defineVi: thực hiện một công việc hoặc nhiệm vụ, thường là cho một công ty hoặc tổ chức, để nhận tiền

examples: Troops drove out the demonstrators.
Hunger drives the wolf out of the wood.
A stream of black cars drove by.
A stream of black cars drove by.
The waves drove against the shore.
words.defineEn: to control the movement and the speed of a car, bus, truck, etc. when it is moving
words.defineVi: để kiểm soát chuyển động và tốc độ của ô tô, xe buýt, xe tải, v.v. khi nó đang di chuyển

examples: My dad bought a stylish suit for his friend's wedding.
The rich man bought a big house and a fancy car.
We bought a bag of coarse sea salt from the specialty store.
She bought an expensive dress for a special occasion.
I bought a pound of fresh meat from the butcher.
words.defineEn: to get something in exchange for paying money
words.defineVi: để có được một cái gì đó để đổi lấy việc trả tiền

examples: Their last album sold millions.
Her last book sold millions of copies.
I recently sold my bike.
The tickets are selling like hot cakes
Do not your lawyers sell all their practice, as your priests their prayers?
words.defineEn: to give something to someone in exchange for money
words.defineVi: để đưa một cái gì đó cho một ai đó để đổi lấy tiền

examples: Generally, the article reads very well.
My son reads twelve pages of his book every day.
Read my lips.
Read my lips.
Teachers should read more poetry to children.
words.defineEn: to look at written or printed words and understand their meaning
words.defineVi: nhìn vào các từ được viết hoặc in và hiểu ý nghĩa của chúng

examples: Write your name at the top of the paper.
I wrote a letter to Alison.
I wrote a letter to the Publicity Department.
She wrote a bestselling novel.
To write an article/essay/report.
words.defineEn: to make letters, words, or numbers on a surface, usually a piece of paper, with a pen or pencil
words.defineVi: để viết các chữ cái, từ hoặc số trên một bề mặt, thường là một mảnh giấy, bằng bút hoặc bút chì

examples: The manager played his strongest side of the season.
The bedside radio played softly.
The media, as always, played an important part in the election campaign.
Fathers play a crucial role in their children's upbringing and development.
His dedication and hard work played a big part in the company's success.
words.defineEn: to take part in a game or activity for fun
words.defineVi: để tham gia vào một trò chơi hoặc hoạt động cho vui

examples: My father pays his bills at the beginning of the month.
Our efforts are finally paying dividends.
Not paying attention.
They both pay their employees badly.
No one paid them any attention.
words.defineEn: to give someone money in exchange for goods or services
words.defineVi: để cung cấp cho ai đó tiền để đổi lấy hàng hóa hoặc dịch vụ

examples: His argument rests on shaky ground.
He gently rested his chin on her shoulder.
The rest of his money went into medical expenses.
May she rest in peace.
I rested my head on a soft pillow to sleep.
words.defineEn: to stop working, moving, or doing an activity for a period of time and sit or lie down to relax
words.defineVi: ngừng làm việc, di chuyển hoặc thực hiện một hoạt động trong một khoảng thời gian và ngồi hoặc nằm xuống để thư giãn

examples: I washed the dishes after dinner.
I washed my face and hands with a bar of soap.
The cat was washing itself.
I’ve washed my hands of the whole affair.
He gently washed his face with warm water and soap.
words.defineEn: to clean someone or something with water, often also with a type of soap
words.defineVi: để làm sạch ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó với nước, thường cũng với một loại xà phòng

examples: The children drank their juice from colorful plastic glasses.
My parents always drink orange juice for breakfast.
Get a drink for John.
I usually drink a cup of green tea in the afternoon.
My brother always drinks smoothie after exercising.
words.defineEn: to put water, coffe, or other type of liquid inside of our body through our mouth
words.defineVi: để đưa nước, cà phê, hoặc loại chất lỏng khác bên trong cơ thể của chúng tôi thông qua miệng của chúng tôi

examples: The chef cooks a delicious meal in the restaurant.
My sister skillfully cooks a flavorful curry for dinner.
Mix cooked conchiglie with cherry tomatoes, cucumbers, and a vinaigrette for a pasta salad.
He cooked a delicious wild rice and mushroom risotto for his vegetarian dinner.
She cooked a mouthwatering pheasant roast for her family's Sunday dinner.
words.defineEn: to make food with heat
words.defineVi: để làm thức ăn với nhiệt

examples: The factory employee was eating lunc in the cafeteria.
so I ate my fill.
I eat pizza on Wednesdays.
I ate a delicious apple for a healthy snack.
I ate a handful of sweet grapes for a refreshing snack.
words.defineEn: to put food into the mouth, then chew and swallow it
words.defineVi: để đưa thức ăn vào miệng, sau đó nhai và nuốt nó

examples: That hot guy had a good head on his shoulders.
The hotel had expensive rates during the holiday season.
The group has a new CD in the pipeline.
The police had the situation well in hand.
The theatre company has several new productions in the pipeline for next season.
words.defineEn: to eat or drink something
words.defineVi: để ăn hoặc uống một cái gì đó

examples: The professor made mincemeat of the speaker at the conference.
The kangaroo was making mincemeat of him.
A couple of years in the army should make a man of him.
Good wine can make a meal.
The news really made my day.
words.defineEn: to form, produce, or prepare something, by putting parts together or by combining materials
words.defineVi: để hình thành, sản xuất hoặc chuẩn bị một cái gì đó, bằng cách đặt các bộ phận lại với nhau hoặc bằng cách kết hợp các vật liệu

examples: His face wore a puzzled look.
Both men wore confident smiles.
My mom wears facial mask sometmes.
The police officer wears a uniform and a badge.
He wears glasses now.
words.defineEn: to have something such as clothes, shoes, etc. on your body
words.defineVi: để có một cái gì đó như quần áo, giày dép, vv trên cơ thể của bạn

examples: The mother gently cleaned her baby's ears with a cotton swab.
A new broom sweeps clean, after all.
Sarah cleans the kitchen counters with a sponge.
She had to clean her dirty car after a long road trip.
She cleans the dining room after each meal.
words.defineEn: to make something have no stains, bacteria, dust, marks, or dirt
words.defineVi: để làm cho một cái gì đó không có vết bẩn, vi khuẩn, bụi, vết hoặc bụi bẩn

examples: We thought the world of our teacher, Mr. Johnson.
He thought like a general.
Many people thought that the Internet would toll the death knell for newspapers.
Politicians think they can easily lead people by the nose.
She really thinks on her feet well.
words.defineEn: to have a type of belief, idea, or opinion about a person or thing
words.defineVi: để có một loại niềm tin, ý tưởng, hoặc quan điểm về một người hoặc điều

examples: Take your pick.
His new world record will take some beating.
His apology took the edge off her anger.
Things like this take time.
The river took a meandering bend through the picturesque valley.
words.defineEn: to reach for something and hold it
words.defineVi: để đạt được cho một cái gì đó và giữ nó

examples: A stable relationship stands the test of time.
The teaching method has stood the test of time.
The guard stood straight as a ramrod.
Men of our generation never stood on ceremony.
My years of teaching stood me in good stead.
words.defineEn: to be upright on one's feet
words.defineVi: đứng thẳng trên đôi chân của mình

examples: His frame spoke tiredness.
He spoke the final words of the play.
The brochure speaks of beautiful secluded grounds.
My mother spoke Russian.
Please speak more slowly.
words.defineEn: to use one's voice to express a particular feeling or to communicate information
words.defineVi: sử dụng giọng nói của một người để thể hiện một cảm giác cụ thể hoặc để truyền đạt thông tin

examples: After all, one case of the trots hardly spells disaster.
The current situation is spelling disaster for the project.
The flowers died during a dry spell.
Failing to properly maintain the equipment could spell disaster for the entire operation.
If we don't take action soon, it will spell disaster for the company.
words.defineEn: to write or say the letters that form a word one by one in the right order
words.defineVi: viết hoặc nói từng chữ cái tạo thành một từ theo đúng thứ tự

examples: I took a dislike to him.
He dislikes the taste of celery and avoids it in his meals.
Dees disliked all editors on principle, but he had to admit that this one at least gave credit where credit was due.
My son dislikes the taste of cayenne pepper as he finds it too spicy.
The person who pursued their passion and found fulfillment in their work was happier than the person who had a high-paying job but disliked what they did.
words.defineEn: to not like a person or thing
words.defineVi: để không thích một người hoặc điều

examples: Next add the flour.
The vibrant purple color of whinberries adds a beautiful touch to desserts like cheesecakes and tarts.
A slice of sweet orange adds a delightful touch to a cold glass of iced tea.
Farmer's cheese adds a delightful creaminess to my morning bowl of granola and fruit.
The agar cubes added a delightful chewiness to the tropical fruit salad.
words.defineEn: to put things together to make them bigger in size or quantity
words.defineVi: để đặt mọi thứ lại với nhau để làm cho chúng lớn hơn về kích thước hoặc số lượng

examples: The hole calls the thief.
The organization called the new regulations a turning point in the campaign against smoking.
To call a meeting/strike.
A classic hot chocolate recipe calls for scalded milk to be mixed with cocoa powder and sugar.
You call that mercy?
words.defineEn: to give a name to an animal or a baby
words.defineVi: đặt tên cho một con vật hoặc một em bé

examples: The cloudy sky created a dramatic backdrop for the sunset.
Reindeer moss creates a soft carpet-like cover on the forest floor in northern regions.
The government has created eight new peers.
The combination of ripe cherimoya and coconut milk created a heavenly dessert pudding.
As the chef, I created a special pizza with ranch sauce instead of traditional tomato sauce.
words.defineEn: to bring something into existence or make something happen
words.defineVi: để đưa một cái gì đó vào sự tồn tại hoặc làm cho một cái gì đó xảy ra

examples: The line cuts the circle at two points.
He's cutting his own throat.
Budget cuts are putting the squeeze on scientific research.
Cutting Jefferson a break?
He really cuts the ground from under my feet.
words.defineEn: to divide a thing into smaller pieces using a sharp object
words.defineVi: để chia một điều thành phần nhỏ hơn bằng cách sử dụng một đối tượng sắc nét
